definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
canvass for contributions/to recruit/to collect/to raise

sentences.english: The name of a public offering foundation may not use a trade name.
sentences.chinese: 公募基金會的名稱可以不使用字號。

sentences.english: We'll give up the public offering, and do public service with private money.
sentences.chinese: 會放棄公募，用非公募的錢做公益。

sentences.english: The enterprises financing via public placement may be limited by high factors.
sentences.chinese: 企業通過公募融資受到很高條件的限制。

sentences.english: Many of America's biggest-gaining initial public offerings this year have been of Chinese firms.
sentences.chinese: 今年很多美國最大收益的首次公募都來自中國公司。

definition: private equity fund/fund offered to private placement (e.g. hedge fund)
to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
